data.title: GraphicsAdapter.SubSystemId can be negative
data.body: This test failed for me because SubSystemId is negative on my laptop.

data.title: Added TitleSafeArea
data.body: Fixes #4840 as per Chuck Walbourns recommendations.

data.title: Add IEffect interface, so alternative implementations of Effect can be used
data.body:
I'm currently working on implementing a render batching pipeline for 3D rendering in Protogame, and I need some way of imitiating the "Effect" class without actually having the costs associated with it.  The current render context in the engine has an `Effect` property with the `Effect` type on it.

In particular, a lot of the code currently looks like:

```

// do some setup on effect, like setting parameter values etc.

renderContext.PushEffect(effect);

someOtherApi.DoSomeRenderingWithCurrentEffect();
```

which internally then calls renderContext.Effect or whatever.

I'd like to be able to have a fake Effect, one that the render batcher can provide which tracks all of the state changes made to the effect and it's parameters (like setting of textures and other values) as the game's render loop runs.

Once the render loop is about to finish, the render batcher would then look at all of the render requests that came through, sort them based on the most optimal way to run them (i.e. group requests where the effect and effect parameters are the same) and then push them to the GPU, reducing the number of draw calls to make.  I want to basically take the game render loop, which may render a whole bunch of different things with different effects, and combine them together into very few draw calls, potentially also making use of `DrawInstancedPrimitives` to reduce it even further.

However, so much of the code is coupled to the Effect API, and because this is a concrete class, it makes it hard to use the API without incurring associated costs, or without the render batching having to clone the effect and it's parameters on every request (itself an expensive operation).

I can't just switch out Effect with some other common API either, because it implements no interfaces, and I want render batching to be optional; if you don't want to use render batching, you shouldn't have to, so it's important that the effect setup can actually be a real effect when needed, and not a fake effect supplied by the render batcher for the purposes of tracking changes.

My proposal is to add an `IEffect` interface and potentially an `IEffectParameter` interface, where their signatures would match the current public APIs of the `Effect` and `EffectParameter` classes.  This would allow me to transparently replace effect with a fake tracking version as needed.

data.title: Fix DynamicSoundEffectInstance stuttering

data.title: SoundEffect issue in UWP on Xbox One
data.body:
When testing the game on Xbox One as UWP everything works great except for strange SFX behavior.

When I start it, SFX work with no issues, start a match and everything is OK even with 16 players at once, then I go to menu and SFX completely stop playing but the game runs fine.
And after some time SFX will continue playing with no issues and this repeats while playing.

This is not happening when I test the UWP project on Windows 10, sound is always playing as it should be.

And another thing, if I Deploy the Release version to Xbox One the SFX are not playing at all but there are no issues if I play it on Windows 10.

And I am testing with latest dev build version, got it just before I wrote this.

@tomspilman @cra0zy

data.title: [SDL] Boderless State spelling

milestone.title: 3.6 Release
milestone.description: More unit tests, running unit tests on Mac and Linux, SDL2 replacing OpenTK.

data.body:
In SDL2.cs Boderless should be Borderless.

[Flags]
public enum State
{
    Fullscreen = 0x00000001,
    OpenGL = 0x00000002,
    Shown = 0x00000004,
    Hidden = 0x00000008,
    **Boderless = 0x00000010**,
    Resizable = 0x00000020,
    Minimized = 0x00000040,
    Maximized = 0x00000080,
    Grabbed = 0x00000100,
    InputFocus = 0x00000200,
    MouseFocus = 0x00000400,
    FullscreenDesktop = 0x00001001,
    Foreign = 0x00000800,
    AllowHighDPI = 0x00002000,
    MouseCapture = 0x00004000,
}

data.title: Texture2D.FromStream now correctly throws on null arguments

data.body: Fixes #5049.

data.title: Better error for Texture2D.FromStream when graphics device is null.
data.body:
I was recently working on loading textures with Texture2D.FromStream and kept getting the following error:

"This image format is not supported"

After fighting with this for about 30 minutes, I realized that the GraphicsDevice I was passing to the method as an argument was unintentionally null. The error that I received above was less than helpful when debugging this problem. Perhaps a better error could be throw when a null GraphicsDevice is provided (such as a NullReferenceException or an ArgumentException).

data.title: Dse stutter
data.body: Fixes #5023. Or at least the OpenAL side for now. These were seperate issues for OpenAL and XAudio after all. I'll check out the XAudio issue tomorrow, but I'm hoping it's the same mistake conceptually that causes it. If that's the case it'll be a quick fix. Should I do a seperate PR or is this one fine for XAudio?

data.title: EnableMouseTouchPoint - Doesn't handle loss of focus well
data.body: Put a breakpoint somewhere in your code that triggers when a press occurs. Then click. You will now have a touch location stuck forever in 'moved' and future clicks also don't seem to register at all anymore.

data.title: DesktopGL template has wrong names of librarys for Mac
data.body:
After downloading the current dev install for XS on MacOS and creating a new project using the Cross Platform template, I am getting the following error below. The MonoGame.Framework.dll.config has the wrong filename for the SDL2 and openal libraries to match the actual files included in the project for the Mac. I am guessing this comes from ./ThirdParty/Dependencies/MonoGame.Framework.dll.config.

These two lines:

```
        <dllmap dll="SDL2.dll" os="osx" target="libSDL2.dylib"/>
        <dllmap dll="soft_oal.dll" os="osx" target="libopenal.dylib" />
```

Should be changed to:

```
    <dllmap dll="SDL2.dll" os="osx" target="libSDL2-2.0.0.dylib" />
    <dllmap dll="soft_oal.dll" os="osx" target="libopenal.1.dylib" />
```

Error:

```
Unhandled Exception:
System.DllNotFoundException: libSDL2.dylib
  at (wrapper managed-to-native) Sdl:GetVersion (Sdl/Version&)
  at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.SdlGamePlatform..ctor (Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Game game) [0x00033] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.GamePlatform.PlatformCreate (Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Game game) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Game..ctor () [0x001fb] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at TestMonoCommon.Game1..ctor () [0x000ba] in /Users/ksuda/Documents/My Xarmarin Projects/TestMono/TestMonoCommon/Game1.cs:67 
  at TestMonoMac1.Program.Main (System.String[] args) [0x00006] in /Users/ksuda/Documents/My Xarmarin Projects/TestMono/TestMonoMac1/Main.cs:23 
[ERROR] FATAL UNHANDLED EXCEPTION: System.DllNotFoundException: libSDL2.dylib
  at (wrapper managed-to-native) Sdl:GetVersion (Sdl/Version&)
  at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.SdlGamePlatform..ctor (Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Game game) [0x00033] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.GamePlatform.PlatformCreate (Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Game game) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Game..ctor () [0x001fb] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at TestMonoCommon.Game1..ctor () [0x000ba] in /Users/ksuda/Documents/My Xarmarin Projects/TestMono/TestMonoCommon/Game1.cs:67 
  at TestMonoMac1.Program.Main (System.String[] args) [0x00006] in /Users/ksuda/Documents/My Xarmarin Projects/TestMono/TestMonoMac1/Main.cs:23
```

data.title: NUnit Failure

milestone.title: 3.6 Release
milestone.description: More unit tests, running unit tests on Mac and Linux, SDL2 replacing OpenTK.

data.body:
We're currently experiencing some sort of error running unit tests under TeamCity.

A build from a July 18th shows 803 tests run:

http://teamcity.monogame.net/viewLog.html?buildId=18960&buildTypeId=MonoGame_TestWindows&tab=buildResultsDiv

A build a few days later on July 22nd shows only 398 tests run:

http://teamcity.monogame.net/viewLog.html?buildId=19164&buildTypeId=MonoGame_TestWindows&tab=buildResultsDiv

Looking further the unit tests seem to be failing mid run:

```
[17:41:56]E:             [MonoGameTests.exe] MonoGame.Tests.Framework.SpriteFontNonVisualTest.MeasureString_returns_correct_values("JingJing","%",21,45) (2s)
[17:41:57]E:                 [MonoGame.Tests.Framework.SpriteFontNonVisualTest.MeasureString_returns_correct_values("JingJing","%",21,45)] [Test Error Output]
System.NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object.
   at NUnit.Core.TestSuite.Run(EventListener listener, ITestFilter filter)
   at NUnit.Core.TestSuite.RunAllTests(TestResult suiteResult, EventListener listener, ITestFilter filter)
   at NUnit.Core.TestSuite.RunSuite(EventListener listener, ITestFilter filter)
   at NUnit.Core.TestSuite.RunSuiteInContext(EventListener listener, ITestFilter filter)
   at NUnit.Core.TestSuite.Run(EventListener listener, ITestFilter filter)
   at NUnit.Core.SimpleTestRunner.Run(EventListener listener, ITestFilter filter, Boolean tracing, LoggingThreshold logLevel)
   at NUnit.Core.TestRunnerThread.TestRunnerThreadProc()
[17:41:57]W:                 [MonoGame.Tests.Framework.SpriteFontNonVisualTest.MeasureString_returns_correct_values("JingJing","%",21,45)] [Test Error Output]
Unhandled exception in remote appdomain: System.ApplicationException: Exception in TestRunnerThread ---> System.NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object.
   at NUnit.Core.TestSuite.Run(EventListener listener, ITestFilter filter)
   at NUnit.Core.TestSuite.RunAllTests(TestResult suiteResult, EventListener listener, ITestFilter filter)
   at NUnit.Core.TestSuite.RunSuite(EventListener listener, ITestFilter filter)
   at NUnit.Core.TestSuite.RunSuiteInContext(EventListener listener, ITestFilter filter)
   at NUnit.Core.TestSuite.Run(EventListener listener, ITestFilter filter)
   at NUnit.Core.SimpleTestRunner.Run(EventListener listener, ITestFilter filter, Boolean tracing, LoggingThreshold logLevel)
   at NUnit.Core.TestRunnerThread.TestRunnerThreadProc()
   --- End of inner exception stack trace ---
   at NUnit.Core.TestRunnerThread.TestRunnerThreadProc()
   at System.Threading.ThreadHelper.ThreadStart_Context(Object state)
   at System.Threading.ExecutionContext.RunInternal(ExecutionContext executionContext, ContextCallback callback, Object state, Boolean preserveSyncCtx)
   at System.Threading.ExecutionContext.Run(ExecutionContext executionContext, ContextCallback callback, Object state, Boolean preserveSyncCtx)
   at System.Threading.ExecutionContext.Run(ExecutionContext executionContext, ContextCallback callback, Object state)
   at System.Threading.ThreadHelper.ThreadStart()
```

This doesn't look like any failure in the unit tests themselves...  this looks like some failure within NUnit itself.

I don't know why it suddenly started failing... there have been no changes to how unit tests are run in quite a while.

Note we're currently running on an old version of NUnit 2.6.0 which is from February 20, 2012.  Could be we should just upgrade to the latest NUnit release to solve this.

data.title: [SDL] Default controller axis values are wrong until manipulated
data.body:
Hello,

With SDL, when one start a project without touching a `GamePad`, triggers axis have a wrong default value until any button/axis of the gamepad is touched.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Start application without touching the gamepad at all.
2. Notice that `SDL_GameControllerGetAxis` returns 16384 for both of the triggers axis (should be 0) which translates to 0.5f `GamePadState.Triggers.Left` (which is supposed to be halfway in).
3. Touch any axis / press any button of the gamepad (it doesn't have to be one of the triggers).
4. Notice that `SDL_GameControllerGetAxis` now returns 0 and other valid values.

Tested on Windows & MacOS with multiple controllers. Does this look like a SDL issue?
I remember that OpenTK had the same issue.

data.title: SharpDX gets wrong resolution causing crash on startup

milestone.title: 3.6 Release
milestone.description: More unit tests, running unit tests on Mac and Linux, SDL2 replacing OpenTK.

data.body:
@tomspilman #5024 caused this issue (the commit before it worked fine). [`monitor.Description.DesktopBounds`](https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/blob/develop/MonoGame.Framework/Graphics/GraphicsAdapter.DirectX.cs#L66) gets incorrect values (1536, 864) which is not a known displaymode for my graphics card, causing adapter._currentDisplayMode not to be set. `GraphicsDevice.DisplayMode` will be null and so [`GraphicsDevice.Setup`](https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/blob/develop/MonoGame.Framework/Graphics/GraphicsDevice.cs#L218) will fail with a `NullReferenceException`.

Looks like this is an issue with SharpDX or maybe incorrect use of the API? I couldn't find this in SharpDX source, so maybe this was a bug that is fixed or API changed. I just updated my graphics drivers, but that didn't help.

Now I can't reproduce this issue on this machine, but the same behavior happened on my friend's Mac.

Environment:
OS X El Capitan, Version 10.11.5 (15F34)

Mono JIT compiler version 4.4.1 (mono-4.4.0-branch-c7sr0/4747417 Mon Jun 20 15:43:48 EDT 2016)
Copyright (C) 2002-2014 Novell, Inc, Xamarin Inc and Contributors. www.mono-project.com

    SIGSEGV:       altstack
    Notification:  kqueue
    Architecture:  x86
    Disabled:      none

    LLVM:          yes(3.6.0svn-mono-master/a173357)
    GC:            sgen

Monogame assembly version: 3.5.1.1679
From Nuget.

I always thought the Monogame was frozen, and end up killing the process, until I decided to let it run for a long time, and it finally opened, now I can't reproduce this behavior.

Restarting the machine did not fix the issue,
Creating another project did not fix the issue,
Running via command line did not fix the issue,
I don't remember if a Release build also had this behavior.

It could only be solved after waiting the executable fix itself.

Did anyone face this long (2+ minutes) time on opening Monogame for the first time?

data.title: 2MGFX, warnings, optimizations and ConstantBuffer
data.body:
**Platform**: OpenGL
**Version**: Latest commit and Release 3.5.1
**Issue**: Destination offset is wrong, count is wrong
**Reproducing**: This is a ~very~ specific case-scenario, but it can happen easily and there's no clear explanation of whats happening.

If you declare a float4x4 in your code and only use it to get a float3 result, it will become a float4x3 with a warning ( "implicit truncation of vector type" ).
Issue is, now we don't have enough space to store float4x4 data (64 bytes), only 48 bytes.

Example of the problem:

```
float4x4 World;

float3 Position = mul(inPosition, World);
```

This will build correctly though 2MGFX on OpenGL, but with a warning. When you apply the pass the data won't be able to be copied.

**Solution**: 
1. Change float4x4 to float4x3 on everything that you won't need a float4 result.
or
2. Change "implicit truncation of vector type" from a warning to an error.

Though it's a simple mistake, I think this can be a block to newcomers (riemers.net tutorials wouldn't work, for example, which is pretty much how I started learning HLSL).

data.title: HiDef conflict with brga5551 fomate
data.body: When Profile is HiDef, new Texture2D(..., brga551) will cause an error in DirectX (0x80070057, E_INVALIDARG). And In Reach, Effect ps_4 cause INVALIDARG also. so I could not run the program.

data.title: Moving MonoGame Repo

milestone.title: 3.6 Release
milestone.description: More unit tests, running unit tests on Mac and Linux, SDL2 replacing OpenTK.

data.body:
We're going to be moving the MonoGame repo from its current location here:

 https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/

... to the MonoGame organization here:

 https://github.com/MonoGame/MonoGame/

We've discuss things with GitHub support staff and the transfer should be 100% transparent as all URLs will redirect to the new location.  Existing clones or forks won't be affected in any way.

All the stars and fork stats for the repo also transfer in the move.

There might be a little issues with the Gitter chat room, but the Gitter staff said they could manually fix things if we have issues.
